analyzed: jānāti passati ubhayattham pi tasmin samaye yathābhūtam jānāti passati dīgharatta
translated: he knows and sees it as it really is.

original: asajjhāyakatāpi mantā paṭibhanti, pageva sajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: a sajjhāyaka tā api mantā paṭibhanti pagā iva sajjhāyaka tā
translated: Even though he has not recited them for a long time, his recitations come back to him, let alone those he has recited recently.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yenekadā dīgharattaṁ asajjhāyakatāpi mantā paṭibhanti, pageva sajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena ikadā dīgharattam a sajjhāyaka tā api mantā paṭibhanti pagā iva sajjhāyaka tā
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why sometimes even though he has not recited them for a long time, his recitations come back to him, let alone those he has recited recently.

original: Sattime, brāhmaṇa, bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: satti me brāhmaṇa bojjhaṅgāḥ anāvaraṇāḥ anīvaraṇā cetasaḥ anupakkilesāḥ bhāvitāḥ bahulīkatāḥ vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyāya savattanti
translated: “Brahman, there are seven factors of Awakening that, when developed and cultivated, lead to the realization of the fruit of true knowledge and liberation.

original: Katame satta?🔽Satisambojjhaṅgo kho, brāhmaṇa, anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anupakkileso bhāvito bahulīkato🔽vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo kho, brāhmaṇa,
analyzed: katame satta  sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ kho brāhmaṇa anāvaraṇaḥ anīvaraṇaḥ cetasaḥ an upakkilesaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ  vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyāya savattati pe upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo kho brāhmaṇa
translated: Which seven?🔽The factor of Complete Awakening that, at that time, is mindfulness is purified so that it is clear and bright, without blemish, without defilement, rid of desire, and not grasping.

original: anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anupakkileso bhāvito bahulīkato vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: an āvaraṇaḥ a nīvaraṇaḥ cetasaḥ an upakkilesaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyāya savattati
translated: The factor of Complete Awakening that, at that time, is equanimity is purified so that it is clear and bright, without blemish, without defilement, rid of desire, and not grasping.

original: Ime kho, brāhmaṇa, satta bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattantī”ti.
analyzed: ime kho brāhmaṇa satta bojjhaṅgāḥ anāvaraṇāḥ anīvaraṇā cetasaḥ anupakkilesāḥ bhāvitāḥ bahulīkatāḥ vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyāya savattanti iti
translated: These seven factors of awakening, unhampered, unimpeded, unconstrained, free of the hindrances and defilements, when developed and cultivated, lead to the realization of the fruit of true knowledge and liberation.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, saṅgāravo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte saṅgāravaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Saṅgārava said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama pe
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent! …

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: Pañcamaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 46.56🔽6. Sākacchavagga
analyzed: pañcama  sayutta nikāya  sā kaccha vagga
translated: The fifth🔽The Connected Discourses with Brahmins

original: Abhayasutta
analyzed: abhayasutta
translated: With Abhaya

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha on the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: Atha kho abhayo rājakumāro yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho abhayo rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu abhayaḥ rāja kumāraḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu abhayaḥ rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then Prince Abhaya approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and said to him:

original: “pūraṇo, bhante, kassapo evamāha:
analyzed: pūraṇaḥ bhante kassapaḥ evam āha
translated: “Venerable sir, Pūraṇa Kassapa says this:

original: ‘natthi hetu, natthi paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.
analyzed: natthi hetu na atthi paccayaḥ aññāṇāya a dassanāya
translated: ‘There is no cause or condition for the defilement of beings.🔽Beings are defiled without cause or condition.

original: Ahetu, appaccayo aññāṇaṁ adassanaṁ hoti.🔽Natthi hetu, natthi paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
analyzed: a hetu a paccayaḥ aññāṇam a dassanam hoti  natthi hetu na atthi paccayaḥ ñāṇāya dassanāya
translated: Ignorance and non-seeing have a cause and a condition.🔽Knowledge and seeing have no cause and no condition.

original: Ahetu, appaccayo ñāṇaṁ dassanaṁ hotī’ti.
analyzed: ahetu appaccayaḥ ñāṇam dassanam hoti iti
translated: Knowledge and seeing have a cause and a condition.”

original: Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
analyzed: bhagavān kim āha ati
translated: What did the Buddha say about this?”

original: “Atthi, rājakumāra, hetu, atthi paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.🔽Sahetu, sappaccayo aññāṇaṁ adassanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: atthi rājakumāra hetu atthi paccayaḥ aññāṇāya a dassanāya  sa hetu sa paccayaḥ aññāṇam a dassanam hoti
translated: “Prince, there is a cause and a condition for ignorance and non-seeing.🔽Ignorance and non-seeing have a cause and a condition.

original: Atthi, rājakumāra, hetu, atthi paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
analyzed: atthi rāja kumāra hetu atthi paccayaḥ ñāṇāya dassanāya
translated: There is a cause and a condition for knowledge and seeing.

original: Sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sa hetu sa paccayaḥ ñāṇam dassanam hoti iti
translated: Knowledge and seeing have a cause and a condition.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante, hetu, katamo paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante hetu katamaḥ paccayaḥ aññāṇāya adassanāya
translated: “But what is the cause and condition for ignorance and non-seeing?

original: Kathaṁ sahetu, sappaccayo aññāṇaṁ adassanaṁ hotī”ti?
analyzed: katham sa hetu sa paccayaḥ aññāṇam adassanam hoti iti
translated: How do ignorance and non-seeing have a cause and a condition?”

original: “Yasmiṁ kho, rājakumāra, samaye kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena, uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ na jānāti na passati—
analyzed: yasmin kho rāja kumāra samaye kāma rāga pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāma rāga paretena uppannassa ca kāma rāgassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na jānāti na passati
translated: “When you live with a mind obsessed by sensual lust, overwhelmed by sensual lust, and you don’t know or see the escape from arisen sensual lust as it actually is present,

original: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.
analyzed: ayam api kho rāja kumāra hetu ayam paccayaḥ aññāṇāya a dassanāya
translated: this is a cause and a condition for ignorance and non-seeing.

original: Evampi sahetu sappaccayo aññāṇaṁ adassanaṁ hoti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, rājakumāra, yasmiṁ samaye byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpādaparetena …pe…
analyzed: evam pi sa hetu sa paccayaḥ aññāṇam adassanam hoti  puna capara rāja kumāra yasmin samaye byāpāda pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpāda paretena pe
translated: This is the cause and the reason why there is ignorance and non-seeing.🔽“Again, prince, when one dwells with a mind obsessed by ill will, overwhelmed by ill will …

original: thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhitena …pe…🔽uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena …pe…
analyzed: thinamiddha pariyuṭṭhitena pe  uddhacca kukkucca pariyuṭṭhitena pe
translated: when one dwells with a mind obsessed by sloth and torpor, overwhelmed by sloth and torpor …🔽when one dwells with a mind obsessed by restlessness and remorse, overwhelmed by restlessness and remorse …

original: vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati vicikicchāparetena, uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ na jānāti na passati—
analyzed: vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati vicikicchā paretena uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na jānāti na passati
translated: when one dwells with a mind obsessed by doubt, overwhelmed by doubt, and one does not understand as it really is the escape from arisen doubt,

original: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.
analyzed: ayam api kho rāja kumāra hetu ayam paccayaḥ aññāṇāya a dassanāya
translated: this is the cause and the reason why there is ignorance and non-seeing.

original: Evampi sahetu sappaccayo aññāṇaṁ adassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: evam pi sa hetu sa paccayaḥ aññāṇam adassanam hoti iti
translated: This is the cause and the reason why there is ignorance and non-seeing.”

original: “Ko nāmāyaṁ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nāmāya bhante dhamma pariyāyaḥ ti
translated: “Venerable sir, what is the name of this discourse on the Dhamma?”

original: “Nīvaraṇā nāmete, rājakumārā”ti.🔽“Taggha, bhagavā, nīvaraṇā;
analyzed: nīvaraṇāḥ nāma ete rāja kumārāḥ ati  tat ha bhagavān nīvaraṇā
translated: “Prince, it is called ‘The Hindrances.’“🔽“Indeed, venerable sir, they are hindrances.

original: taggha, sugata, nīvaraṇā.
analyzed: tat ha sugata nīvaraṇā
translated: Indeed, venerable sir, they are hindrances.

original: Ekamekenapi kho, bhante, nīvaraṇena abhibhūto yathābhūtaṁ na jāneyya na passeyya, ko pana vādo pañcahi nīvaraṇehi?
analyzed: ekam ekena api kho bhante nīvaraṇena abhibhūtaḥ yathābhūtam na jāneyya na passeyya kaḥ pana vādaḥ pañcahi nīvaraṇehi
translated: Even with just one hindrance, venerable sir, one would not know or see correctly, so what shall I say about five?

original: Katamo pana, bhante, hetu, katamo paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante hetu katamaḥ paccayaḥ ñāṇāya dassanāya
translated: What, venerable sir, is the cause and reason why there is knowledge and vision?

original: Kathaṁ sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti?
analyzed: katham sa hetu sa paccayaḥ ñāṇam dassanam hoti iti
translated: How is it that there is knowledge and vision with cause and reason?”

original: “Idha, rājakumāra, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ.
analyzed: idha rāja kumāra bhikkhu sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vossagga pariṇāmi
translated: “Here, prince, a bhikkhu develops the enlightenment factor of mindfulness, which is based upon seclusion, dispassion, and cessation, maturing in release.

original: So satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvitena cittena yathābhūtaṁ jānāti passati—
analyzed: so sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāvitena cittena yathābhūtam jānāti passati
translated: With a mind that has developed the enlightenment factor of mindfulness, he knows and sees things as they really are.

original: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
analyzed: ayam api kho rāja kumāra hetu ayam paccayaḥ ñāṇāya dassanāya
translated: This is the cause and reason why there is knowledge and vision.

original: Evampi sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṁ dassanaṁ hoti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, rājakumāra, bhikkhu …pe…
analyzed: evam pi sa hetu sa paccayaḥ ñāṇam dassanam hoti  puna capara rāja kumāra bhikkhu pe
translated: Thus there is knowledge and vision with cause and reason.🔽“Again, prince, a bhikkhu develops the enlightenment factor of discrimination of phenomena…🔽the enlightenment factor of energy…🔽the enlightenment factor of rapture…

original: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ.
analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vossagga pariṇāmi
translated: the enlightenment factor of tranquillity…🔽the enlightenment factor of concentration…🔽the enlightenment factor of equanimity, which is based upon seclusion, dispassion, and cessation, maturing in release.

original: So upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvitena cittena yathābhūtaṁ jānāti passati—
analyzed: so upekkhā sambojjhaṅgam bhāvitena cittena yathābhūtam jānāti passati
translated: He knows and sees things as they actually are with a mind developed in the factor of complete awakening that is equanimity.

original: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
analyzed: ayam api kho rāja kumāra hetu ayam paccayaḥ ñāṇāya dassanāya
translated: This is the cause and reason why there is knowledge and vision.

original: Evaṁ sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: evam sa hetu sa paccayaḥ ñāṇam dassanam hoti iti
translated: In this way, knowledge and vision come about with cause and reason.”

original: “Ko nāmāyaṁ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nāmāya bhante dhamma pariyāyaḥ ti
translated: “What is the name of this discourse on the Dhamma?”

original: “Bojjhaṅgā nāmete, rājakumārā”ti.🔽“Taggha, bhagavā, bojjhaṅgā;
analyzed: bojjhaṅgāḥ nāma ete rāja kumārāḥ ati  tat ha bhagavā bojjhaṅgā
translated: “Great prince, it’s called ‘The Factors for Awakening.’”🔽“Indeed, Blessed One, it’s the factors for awakening.

original: taggha, sugata, bojjhaṅgā.
analyzed: tat ha sugata bojjhaṅgā
translated: Indeed, Sublime One, it’s the factors for awakening.

original: Ekamekenapi kho, bhante, bojjhaṅgena samannāgato yathābhūtaṁ jāneyya passeyya, ko pana vādo sattahi bojjhaṅgehi?
analyzed: ekam ekena api kho bhante bojjhaṅgena samannāgataḥ yathābhūtam jāneyya passeyya kaḥ pana vādaḥ sattahi bojjhaṅgehi
translated: If someone were to know and see things as they actually are with just one of these factors for awakening, they would know and see things as they actually are. So what about someone with all seven?

original: Yopi me, bhante, gijjhakūṭaṁ pabbataṁ ārohantassa kāyakilamatho cittakilamatho, sopi me paṭippassaddho, dhammo ca me abhisamito”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ api me bhante gijjhakūṭam pabbatam ārohantassa kāya kilamatho citta kilamatho saḥ api me paṭippassaddhaḥ dhammo ca me abhisamito ti
translated: And, Sir, the fatigue and exhaustion of my body and mind as I was climbing Vulture Peak Mountain has now subsided, and the Teaching has been penetrated.”

original: Chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: chaṭṭha
translated: The sixth.

original: Sākacchavaggo chaṭṭho.🔽Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: sākaccha vaggaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ  tassa uddāna
translated: The sixth sub-chapter on discussion is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Āhārā pariyāyamaggi,
analyzed: āhārā
translated: Food, and the end of the world, fire,

original: mettaṁ saṅgāravena ca;
analyzed: mettam saṅgāravena ca
translated: loving kindness, and with the army,

original: Abhayo pucchito pañhaṁ,
analyzed: abhayo pucchito pañha
translated: Abhaya asked a question,

original: gijjhakūṭamhi pabbateti.
analyzed: gijjhakūṭamhi pabbata iti
translated: on Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: Saṁyutta Nikāya 46.57🔽7. Ānāpānavagga
analyzed: sayutta nikāya  āna apāna vagga
translated: Linked Discourses The Perfected Ones The Perfected Ones 🔽7. The Ānāpānasati Sutta

original: Aṭṭhikamahapphalasutta
analyzed: aṭṭhikamahapphala sutta
translated: Linked Discourses The Ānāpānasati Sutta The Skeleton, the Corpse, and the Worm-Infested Corpse

original: Sāvatthinidānaṁ.
analyzed: sāvatthi nidāna
translated: At Sāvatthī.

original: “Aṭṭhikasaññā, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
analyzed: aṭṭhika saññā bhikkhave bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahā nisasā
translated: “Monks, when the perception of a skeleton is developed and cultivated, it is very fruitful and beneficial.

original: Kathaṁ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭhikasaññā kathaṁ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā?
analyzed: katham bhāvitā ca bhikkhave aṭṭhika saññā katham bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahā nisasā
translated: And how is the perception of a skeleton developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aṭṭhikasaññāsahagataṁ satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ …pe…
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu aṭṭhika saññā sahagatam sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vossagga pariṇāmim pe
translated: Here, monks, a monk develops the mindfulness factor of complete awakening accompanied by the perception of a skeleton, dependent on seclusion, dependent on dispassion, dependent on cessation, resulting in letting go. …

original: aṭṭhikasaññāsahagataṁ upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhika saññā sahagatam upekkhā sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vossagga pariṇāmi
translated: He develops the equanimity factor of complete awakening accompanied by the perception of a skeleton, dependent on seclusion, dependent on dispassion, dependent on cessation, resulting in letting go.

original: Evaṁ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhikasaññā evaṁ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā”ti.
analyzed: evam bhāvitā kho bhikkhave aṭṭhika saññā evam bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahā nisasā ati
translated: When the perception of a skeleton is developed and cultivated in this way, it is very fruitful and beneficial.”

original: Aññataraphalasutta
analyzed: aññatara phala sutta
translated: The Fruit of Another

original: “Aṭṭhikasaññāya, bhikkhave, bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya dvinnaṁ phalānaṁ aññataraṁ phalaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—diṭṭheva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā.
analyzed: aṭṭhika saññāya bhikkhave bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya dvinnam phalānam aññataram phalam pāṭikaṅkha diṭṭhā iva dhamme aññā sati vā upādisese anāgāmi tā
translated: “When the perception of a skeleton has been developed and cultivated, one of two results may be expected: either gnosis right here and now, or, if there is a residue of clinging, the state of non-return.

original: Kathaṁ bhāvitāya ca kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhikasaññāya kathaṁ bahulīkatāya dvinnaṁ phalānaṁ aññataraṁ phalaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—diṭṭheva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā?
analyzed: katham bhāvitāya ca kho bhikkhave aṭṭhika saññāya katham bahulīkatāya dvinnam phalānam aññataram phalam pāṭikaṅkha diṭṭhā iva dhamme aññā sati vā upādisese anāgāmi tā
translated: “And how is it, bhikkhus, that when the perception of a skeleton has been developed and cultivated, one of two results may be expected: either gnosis right here and now, or, if there is a residue of clinging, the state of non-return?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu aṭṭhikasaññāsahagataṁ satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …pe…
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu aṭṭhika saññā sahagatam sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti pe
translated: Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu develops the mindfulness factor of complete awakening accompanied by the perception of a skeleton …
